segment.documentation: BGM, A segment identifying the type and the reference number of the message to which the CUSRES is a response.
DTM, A segment identifying the relevant dates and times in the message. For example, payment date.
FTX, A segment stating information in unsolicited clear text.
TDT, A segment to specify any means of transport that is related to all information at the lower level of the message.
LOC, A segment to identify a country and/or place and/or location information related to the whole message.
GEI, A segment identifying the various customs processing indicators. For example, cargo released, cargo held, examination required, earlier message accepted or rejected, etc.
EQD, A segment identifying equipment initials and numbers required to identify a shipment, covering the whole message, e.g. to indicate the container number that Customs wants to examine.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 1: A group of segments identifying party details, including contact and communication contact information.

segment.documentation: NAD, A segment to identify the name and/or address of the party related to all information at the lower level of the message. For example, the importer.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 2: A group of segments identifying contact and communication contact information.

segment.documentation: CTA, A segment to identify a person or a department to whom communication should be directed.
COM, A segment to identify a communication number of a department or a person to whom communication should be directed.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 3: A group of segments identifying references, dates and locations related information.

segment.documentation: RFF, A segment identifying references (e.g. manifest number).
DTM, A segment identifying a date related to the preceding RFF.
LOC, A segment identifying a location related to the preceding RFF.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 4: A group of segments identifying an application error condition within a message to which the CUSRES is a response.

segment.documentation: ERP, A segment identifying the location of an application error within the referenced message.
RFF, A segment to provide the references related to the application error.
ERC, A segment identifying the type of application errors within a message.
FTX, A segment to provide explanation and/or supplementary information related to the specified application error.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 5: A group of segments identifying the customs amounts for duties, taxes and fees, following computation by customs, for all customs declarations.

segment.documentation: TAX, A segment identifying the tax and/or duty and/or fee type, rate and base totals for all customs declarations.
MOA, A segment to identify a tax and/or duty and/or fee amount related to TAX.
GEI, A segment identifying method of payment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 6: SG7-SG9-SG10-SG11-SG13 A group of segments specifying goods item details including status of goods, related references, package identification, details of transport, relevant parties, contacts, dates and/or times and location, general indicators, measurements, documentary requirements, monetary amounts, currencies and item taxes, fees and duties.

segment.documentation: DOC, A segment to identify the master bill number reported in a multi-consignment message. This segment can also be used to identify the Customs declaration where the CUSRES is responding to multiple declarations.
PAC, A segment identifying number and type of packages.
RFF, A segment identifying a particular reference, e.g. house of bill number, master bill number.
PCI, A segment identifying marking and labels on individual shipping or packing units.
FTX, A segment to provide the goods description.
TDT, A segment to identify any means of transport that is related to a part of the information in the message. For example, when one CUSRES message contains more than one release note.
LOC, A segment identifying the places relevant to the item, which is different from the places identified at header level. For example, customs house of entry, warehouse, etc.
DTM, A segment identifying necessary dates.
GEI, A segment identifying customs processing indicator at item level.
MEA, Segment identifying various measurement values.
EQD, A segment identifying equipment initials and numbers.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 7: A group of segments identifying information on the party and other contact and communication contact information related only to part of the message.

segment.documentation: NAD, A segment identifying information about a party related only to a part of the message. For example, in a message with several release notes or in a message related to several declarations, a customs agent and the person responsible for the information.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 8: A group of segments identifying contact and communication contact information.

segment.documentation: CTA, A segment to identify a person or a department to whom communication should be directed.
COM, A segment to identify a communication number of a department or a person to whom communication should be directed.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 9: A group of segments identifying the monetary amount, currencies and the rate of exchange, against which duties, taxes or fees are being computed, per item.

segment.documentation: MOA, A segment identifying the monetary amount.
CUX, A segment identifying currencies and the rate of exchange for a monetary amount identified within this group.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 10: A group of segments identifying customs amounts for taxes, duties and fees related to a single customs declaration (e.g. a simplified customs declaration).

segment.documentation: TAX, A segment identifying tax/duty/fee related to a single customs declaration.
MOA, A segment identifying tax/duty/fee amounts related to TAX.
GEI, A segment identifying the methods of payment related to TAX.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 11: A group of segments identifying goods in terms of customs identities and customs amounts for duties, taxes and fees, following computation by customs.

segment.documentation: CST, A segment identifying goods in terms of customs identities, status and intended use.
FTX, A segment to specify the goods description.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 12: A group of segments identifying the customs amounts for- duties, taxes and fees related to the customs items identified in CST.

segment.documentation: TAX, A segment identifying the tax and/or duty and/or fee type, rate and base for customs item amounts.
MOA, A segment identifying a tax and/or duty and/or fee amount related to TAX.
GEI, A segment identifying method of payment.
MEA, A segment to identify measurements related to the calculation of the customs duties.
RFF, A segment to identify reference numbers related to the tax calculations (e.g. reference number for VAT free allowance).

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 13: A group of segments identifying an application error condition related only to a part of the message.

segment.documentation: ERP, A segment identifying the location of an application error.
RFF, A segment to provide the references related to the application error.
ERC, A segment identifying the type of application errors.
FTX, A segment to provide explanation and/or supplementary information related to the specified application error.
CNT, A segment to identify control totals.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 14: A group of segments permitting the verification of the authenticity of the sender and the integrity of the data.

segment.documentation: AUT, A segment containing the result of the algorithm permitting the verification of the authenticity of the sender and the integrity of the data.
DTM, A segment identifying a date associated with the preceding AUT.
